conversation.content: What is SabreMosaic and how does it help with canceling air exchanged items?

SabreMosaic is a capability that enables users to cancel air exchanged items and corresponding ancillaries like seats, bags, and other EMD-A items. Previously, the cancel operation was limited to the initial air order and corresponding EMD-As, but now it allows for the cancellation of the most recent air exchanged order item and EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, which are not automatically canceled by PSS.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to a certain time before the scheduled time, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or provide me with the details, and I can help you further!

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to a certain time before the scheduled time, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or provide me with the details, and I can help you further!

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or not allow it at all. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or not allow it at all. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

reference_contexts:
High-level Business Need / Market Problems

What is the customer's high-level business need or market problem? (What are the drivers? Who exactly (persona) is affected by the problem? What is customer’s problem? Why is this a problem? How often do they face the problem? How much does the problem cost to customer? How does customer solve the problem today? Consequences of not solving the problem? What data supports/invalidates our assumptions and beliefs about problem?​) 

This capability will enable user to cancel air exchanged item and also corresponding ancillaries like: seat, bags and all other EMD-A items. Previously SabreMosaic cancel operation was limited to cancel initial air order and corresponding EMD-As, but now regardless of number of exchanges we will be able to cancel recent air exchanged order_item and also EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, that are not automatically canceled by PSS.

When an OrderItem is exchanged, and then ultimately refunded, the applicable refundability rules from the Original itinerary apply.

If the  refundability of the exchange is more restrictive (higher penalty, rules) , the rules that apply to the exchange apply in the case of a cancelation

 Objectives for a Successful Solution 

What objectives does the customer need to accomplish? (What is the customer’s goal(s)?)

The most restrictive of the refundability rules apply when a changed order item/order is subsequently canceled

 Business Value  

What is the measurable benefit delivered? (What is the value of what we’re doing? What benefits user gets while using solution? How customer describes value? What is the value for customer? How the solution address the problem?​ Why do we decided to solve the problem?​ What is unique about our value proposition? How does it differentiate from existing solutions? Does this uniqueness matter to customers?)

Will protect the airline from leakage by rule bypassing

 What Success Looks Like

What conditions must be met?  (What are the verifiable results? How do you define success of this capability?​ How to measure success?​ How customer measure success?​ How will it impact customer?​ What quantitative metrics can be used to measure value proposition?​)   

The most restrictive of the refundability rules apply when a changed order item/order is subsequently canceled

Previously, the cancel operation was limited to the initial air order and corresponding EMD-As, but now it allows for the cancellation of the most recent air exchanged order item and EMS-A items with OUT_OF_SYNC status, which are not automatically canceled by PSS.

conversation.content: What is SabreMosaic and how it help with program goals and key results in travel industry?

SabreMosaic is a technology platform that supports the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic, proving its viability for applications beyond low-cost carriers (LCC). This capability is essential for demonstrating how it aligns with program goals and key results.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel a booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you used to make the booking. Many places have a strict 24-hour cancellation policy, while others may allow for last-minute changes. Please check the specific terms or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel a booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you used to make the booking. Many places have a strict 24-hour cancellation policy, while others may allow for last-minute changes. Please check the specific terms or contact customer support for assistance.

Program OKRs relations

Which OKRs are being supported by this capability?​

Prove SabreMosaic is a viable technology platform for beyond LCC (SabreSonic)

How this capability supports Program goals and key results?

This will show that the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic is possible.

Hypothesis to be validated 

1. Enter data here if applicable

Is / Is not in Scope

In Scope Out of Scope applying the original refundability rules in case an exchange is ultimately refunded exchange with refund applying the most restrictive refundability rules  , the original or the exchange, when an exchange is ultimately refunded applies to air and non-air Order Reshop Cancel and Refund Exchanged on Host/Cancel Cancel Air after one Air Exchange and Cancel Air after Subsequent Air exchanges Cancel on host after exchanged - sync scenarios should cover this use case Cancel EMD-A, EMD-S after air exchange, Cancel EMD-A after subsequent EMD-A exchange JSON and NDC API

Anticipated or identified risks and dependencies

What are business risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are project risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are external dependencies?

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are technical/technology risk?

{Enter information here as applicable}

Team(s) Involved

Domain Team(s) Involved (Y or N) Offer -  Shopping Engine Offer - RMX Y Availability and Inventory Order Management/APIs and Plugin's (OMS) Y SabreMosaic UI ? Data Engineering and Science Y E2E QA Y Platform Team N SRE+ N

External Team(s) Involved

External Team (outside of SabreMosaic) Team(s) Involved (Y or N) OFS ? PostCalc ? Intellisell (Isell) ? Ancillaries (ANCS) ? Tax Team N Payments (SEPG) N Pricing ? PNR Services N Google N Radixx N UX N

Assumptions

We don’t expect any schema changes under JSON or XML/NDC SabreMosaic APIs.

We don’t expect any changes under OfferServicingService JSON schema.

We will not implement any rollback mechanism to previous order_item_1, and we will leave the order with unserviceable states that required Agent intervention.

Use cases like: cancel unpaid, void and cancel, void payment, will require agent intervention as we will not fully handle them by SabreMosaic.

Canceling air together with EMD-A and EMD-S items may cause ancillary items to be automatically cancelled by PSS or items will become OUT_OF_SYNC and ready to execute Cancel or Exchange by Sabre Mosaic.

Although we won’t change any SabreMosaic schemas, we will start populating new Reshop Responses in new way for many use cases.

Impacted components: RMX, OSS, OMS, OFS, DW, POS

Development with MVP mode with all corresponding disciplines.

Targeted carrier: Existing SabreMosaic customer JU and VA

Testing carrier: SabreMosaic (X0)



RMX development need to be secured by Feature Flag: FEA97211_CancelAfterExchange
reference: SabreMosaic is a technology platform that supports the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic, proving its viability for applications beyond low-cost carriers (LCC). This capability is essential for demonstrating how it aligns with program goals and key results.

conversation.content: What business value does the new capability of canceling air exchanged items and corresponding ancillaries provide, and how does it relate to the program OKRs for improving customer satisfaction in ticketing processes?

The new capability of canceling air exchanged items and corresponding ancillaries, such as seats and bags, provides significant business value by allowing travel agencies greater flexibility in managing cancellations. This capability addresses high-level business needs by enabling users to cancel recent air exchanged orders and EMD-A items that are not automatically canceled by the PSS, thus preventing potential revenue leakage for airlines. The measurable benefits include enhanced customer satisfaction as agencies can better handle cancellations within the defined void period. This aligns with program OKRs aimed at improving customer satisfaction in ticketing processes by ensuring that users have the necessary options to manage their orders effectively, thereby addressing customer pain points and enhancing overall service delivery.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many providers allow cancellations within 24 hours but may charge a fee. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many providers allow cancellations within 24 hours but may charge a fee. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or not allow it at all. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or not allow it at all. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Cancel under Fare Rule Conditions (user's mistake) - enforcing the Refund during Void period

Void and Retain

Void and Refund (void and cancel order items)

NEW REQ flag: Return all cancel options 

  "request": {

        "updateOrder": {

Cancel Order and Maintain Value ( Air Items and Ancillaries, Seats in this FEA tbc) - RespendInd in IATA NDC schema

Nice to have, consistent naming in UI:



Cancel Options: Cancel Order and Payment (instead of Reservation and Payment) 

 Business Value

Depending on use case, travel agencies will have flexibility in choosing Cancel or Void option, when Cancel request is within 24h from ticketing/order payment

reference: The new capability of canceling air exchanged items and corresponding ancillaries, such as seats and bags, provides significant business value by allowing travel agencies greater flexibility in managing cancellations. This capability addresses high-level business needs by enabling users to cancel recent air exchanged orders and EMD-A items that are not automatically canceled by the PSS, thus preventing potential revenue leakage for airlines. conversation.content: What are the agent options for ticket management that enhance customer satisfaction, and how do they relate to the scope definition of canceling orders under fare rule conditions?

The agent options for ticket management that enhance customer satisfaction include the ability to void a ticket due to an agent's mistake or cancel a ticket under fare conditions due to a customer's mistake. This is particularly relevant within the defined void period, where the OrderReShop Cancel should provide users with options such as 'Cancel under Fare Rule Conditions' and 'Void and Retain'. The scope definition emphasizes the need for flexibility in choosing between canceling or voiding an order, especially when the cancel request is made within 24 hours from ticketing or order payment. This flexibility is crucial for travel agencies to meet customer needs effectively.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my check-in time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of your booking. Many hotels and services allow free cancellations up to 24 hours before check-in, but some may charge a fee or not allow cancellations at all. Please check your booking details or contact customer support for specific information.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my check-in time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of your booking. Many hotels and services allow free cancellations up to 24 hours before check-in, but some may charge a fee or not allow cancellations at all. Please check your booking details or contact customer support for specific information.

conversation.content: What is the high-level business need for VA regarding ticket cancellation options, and how does this relate to the capabilities supported by the SabreMosaic technology platform?

The high-level business need for VA is to have an additional option called 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' within the ticket Void Period, which typically allows voiding within 24 hours after ticketing. This need arises because airlines require agents to have the flexibility to either void a ticket due to their mistake or cancel it under fare conditions due to a customer's mistake. This capability supports the SabreMosaic technology platform by proving its viability for handling complex scenarios like cancellations and exchanges, thereby aligning with the program goals and key results.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many providers allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or let me know the details, and I can help you further!

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many providers allow cancellations within 24 hours, but some may charge a fee or have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or let me know the details, and I can help you further!

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Depending on use case, travel agencies will have flexibility in choosing Cancel or Void option, when Cancel request is within 24h from ticketing/order payment
reference: The high-level business need for VA is to have an additional option called 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' within the ticket Void Period, which typically allows voiding within 24 hours after ticketing. This need arises because airlines require agents to have the flexibility to either void a ticket due to their mistake or cancel it under fare conditions due to a customer's mistake. This capability supports the SabreMosaic technology platform by proving its viability for handling complex scenarios like cancellations and exchanges, thereby aligning with the program goals and key results.

conversation.content: How does the implementation of the 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' option for VA enhance the ticketing process and improve customer satisfaction in travel agencies?

The implementation of the 'Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions' option for VA enhances the ticketing process by providing agents with the flexibility to either void a ticket due to their mistake or cancel it under fare conditions in case of a customer's mistake. This capability is crucial within the void period defined by the airline, as it allows for enforcing refunds during this time. By offering these options, travel agencies can better address customer needs, leading to improved customer satisfaction and a more efficient ticketing process.

Follow-up Q2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to a few hours before the scheduled time, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 2: **User Question #2:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within 24 hours of the scheduled time?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many services allow cancellations up to a few hours before the scheduled time, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Follow-up Q3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

AI Response 3: **User Question #3:** Can I cancel my booking if it's within the 24-hour window before my reservation?

**AI Response:** It depends on the cancellation policy of the service you booked. Many places allow cancellations up to 24 hours in advance, but some may have stricter rules. Please check the specific terms for your booking or contact customer support for assistance.

Prove SabreMosaic is a viable technology platform for beyond LCC (SabreSonic)

How this capability supports Program goals and key results?

This will show that the convergence of SabreSonic into SabreMosaic is possible.

Hypothesis to be validated 

1. Enter data here if applicable

Is / Is not in Scope

In Scope Out of Scope applying the original refundability rules in case an exchange is ultimately refunded exchange with refund applying the most restrictive refundability rules  , the original or the exchange, when an exchange is ultimately refunded applies to air and non-air Order Reshop Cancel and Refund Exchanged on Host/Cancel Cancel Air after one Air Exchange and Cancel Air after Subsequent Air exchanges Cancel on host after exchanged - sync scenarios should cover this use case Cancel EMD-A, EMD-S after air exchange, Cancel EMD-A after subsequent EMD-A exchange JSON and NDC API

Anticipated or identified risks and dependencies

What are business risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are project risks?​

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are external dependencies?

{Enter information here as applicable}

What are technical/technology risk?

{Enter information here as applicable}

Team(s) Involved

Domain Team(s) Involved (Y or N) Offer -  Shopping Engine Offer - RMX Y Availability and Inventory Order Management/APIs and Plugin's (OMS) Y SabreMosaic UI ? Data Engineering and Science Y E2E QA Y Platform Team N SRE+ N

External Team(s) Involved

External Team (outside of SabreMosaic) Team(s) Involved (Y or N) OFS ? PostCalc ? Intellisell (Isell) ? Ancillaries (ANCS) ? Tax Team N Payments (SEPG) N Pricing ? PNR Services N Google N Radixx N UX N

Assumptions

We don’t expect any schema changes under JSON or XML/NDC SabreMosaic APIs.

We don’t expect any changes under OfferServicingService JSON schema.

We will not implement any rollback mechanism to previous order_item_1, and we will leave the order with unserviceable states that required Agent intervention.

Use cases like: cancel unpaid, void and cancel, void payment, will require agent intervention as we will not fully handle them by SabreMosaic.

Canceling air together with EMD-A and EMD-S items may cause ancillary items to be automatically cancelled by PSS or items will become OUT_OF_SYNC and ready to execute Cancel or Exchange by Sabre Mosaic.

Although we won’t change any SabreMosaic schemas, we will start populating new Reshop Responses in new way for many use cases.

Impacted components: RMX, OSS, OMS, OFS, DW, POS

Development with MVP mode with all corresponding disciplines.

Targeted carrier: Existing SabreMosaic customer JU and VA

Testing carrier: SabreMosaic (X0)



RMX development need to be secured by Feature Flag: FEA97211_CancelAfterExchange

What data supports/invalidates our assumptions and beliefs about problem?​) 

VA would like to have additional option "Cancel Under Fare Rule Conditions" within the ticket Void Period (usually Void is allowed within 24h after ticketing)

Airline needs to have both options for the agent to either: void the ticket (their mistake) or cancel the ticket under the fare conditions (customers mistake)

 Objectives for a Successful Solution
